DOC.brief_summary: Study the effect of rofecoxib 50 mg compared to both placebo, and hydrocodone 7.5 mg with acetaminophen 750 mg, to treat moderate to severe pain following arthroscopic knee surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Rofecoxib and a Narcotic Analgesic to Treat Pain Following Arthroscopic Surgery (0966-179)(COMPLETED)
DOC.criteria: Elective outpatient arthroscopic knee surgery expected to last <= 90 minutes using general anesthesia Patients must experience moderate to severe pain following surgery Patient must be in general good health as judged by the primary investigator Osteoarthritis; rheumatoid arthritis Allergy/sensitivity to aspirin, ibuprofen, indomethacin, other NSAIDs, COX2 inhibitors (e.g., rofecoxib, celecoxib), hydrocodone, acetaminophen Asthma associated with nasal polyps Any arthroscopic knee surgery in the past 6 months
